item.title: Shiny Pedon Summary: Loafercreek & Gopheridge demo
item.description: This is the Shiny “flexdashboard” version of the “pedon summary report” originally developed by Dylan Beaudette. I have developed and refined this dashboard periodically over several years. I developed it initially as a very simple interface to semi-automate viewing profile sketches and report generation based on mapunit, series name and taxon kind. https://brownag.shinyapps.io/ShinyPedonSummary/ This tool has been part of the ncss-tech soilReports package for a while now, but recent revisions improve efficiency and produce static output matching the original report Dylan developed.

item.title: Estimations of Soil Depth with aqp
item.description: Estimation of soil depth in aqp R package Estimation functions for soils try to calculate unknown properties based on existing observations and known relationships. The term pedotransfer function was coined by Johan Bouma as “translating data we have into what we need.” Soil surveys, and especially the primary descriptions collected by field soil scientists, offer many opportunities for leveraging this type of information. In Algorithms for Quantitative Pedology aqp, the heuristics are defined in terms of R code.

item.title: Mollic epipedon thickness requirement
item.description: [This functionality has been live in aqp since version 1.21+] Here is a demonstration of some new functionality I am working on for evaluating taxonomic criteria with aqp. mollic.thickness.requirement calculates the minimum thickness of the materials meeting other requirements for a mollic epipedon, per criterion 6 in U.S. Soil Taxonomy (12th edition). item.title: loafercreek - aqp profileApply() tutorial
item.description: This is a tutorial (worked examples and exercises) demonstrating use of the profileApply() function from the R package aqp. http://ncss-tech.github.io/AQP/demos/profileApply/loafercreek.html It loads a dataset, called loafercreek from the R package soilDB. The analysis is supported by the package sharpshootR. These packages are in large part developed by Dylan Beaudette, but there now are many contributors within NCSS. Loafercreek the dataset is a collection of mostly moderately deep Ultic Haploxeralfs on metavolcanic rock from the CA630 soil survey area (parts of Calaveras and Tuolumne Counties.
